meanings.definition: Transfer back the title to (property) to a former owner.
meanings.sent1: After many years, the house was reconveyed to its original owner.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer helped reconvey the land to the rightful heir.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to reconvey the toy mouse back to its owner.
meanings.sent4: The river seemed to reconvey the fallen leaves downstream.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a fun game to reconvey the concept to the students.

meanings.definition: To convey back or transfer again.
meanings.sent1: They had to reconvey the message to the other team.
meanings.sent2: The courier had to reconvey the package due to an address error.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel had to reconvey the nut after dropping it from the tree.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to reconvey the fallen petals across the garden.
meanings.sent5: She had to reconvey her thoughts to make them clearer to her friend.
